squidpony.squidgrid.fov

Class RayCastingFOV

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.fov.RayCastingFOV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FOVSolver

    public class RayCastingFOV
extends java.lang.Object
implements FOVSolver
    Simple raytracing algorithm for Field of View. In large areas will be relatively inefficient due to repeated visiting of some cells. Tracing is done from four points near the corners of the cells. The line between points is then traversed to find what cells are intersected. Once the traversal hits an opaque cell, runs out of light (based on decay), or reaches the set radius, that walk is terminated. This algorithm treats transparency as either fully transparent or fully opaque. If a cell's transparency is less than 1 it is treated as transparent. Light will decay, with solid objects being lit if there is a lit cell next to them in the direction of the source point. Such objects will be lit according to the decay so a solid object at the edge of vision will not be lit if a transparent object in the same cell would not be lit.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - eben@squidpony.com

    • Method Detail

      • calculateFOV

        public float[][] calculateFOV(FOVCell[][] map,
                     int startx,
                     int starty,
                     float force,
                     float decay,
                     boolean simplifiedDiagonals,
                     java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: FOVSolver
        Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y coordinates. Returns a lightmap for a result where the values represent a percentage of fully lit. In general a value equal to or below 0 means that cell is not in the field of view, whereas a value equal to or above 1 means that cell is fully in the Note that values below 0 and above 1 may be returned in certain circumstances. field of view. In these cases it is up to the calling class to determine how to treat such values. The starting point for the calculations is considered to be at the center of the origin cell. Each whole number reaches one cell away horizontally and vertically.
        Specified by:
        calculateFOV in interface FOVSolver
        Parameters:
        map - the grid of cells to calculate on
        startx - the horizontal component of the starting location
        starty - the vertical component of the starting location
        force - the power of the ray
        decay - how much the light is reduced for each whole integer step in distance
        simplifiedDiagonals - if true then diagonal distances are treated as if they are the same distance as horizontal and vertical distances
        key - the String associated with the type of view desired, such as "sight" or "scent"
        Returns:
        the compute light grid

      • calculateFOV

        public float[][] calculateFOV(FOVCell[][] map,
                     int startx,
                     int starty,
                     float radius)
        Description copied from interface: FOVSolver
        Calculates the Field of View in the same manner as the version with more parameters. Assumes decay to be 1, so light will extend to the radius value. Uses simplified diagonals. Uses the empty String for the key.
        Specified by:
        calculateFOV in interface FOVSolver
        Parameters:
        map - the grid of cells to calculate on
        Returns:
